rca.title: MTPL (RCA)
rca.description: Get your MTPL (RCA) policy directly on our website. We offer affordable prices and convenient service.
rca.longDescription: MTPL, or Mandatory Third Party Liability Insurance, is a reliable form of protection while driving in Moldova. This insurance provides a safeguard for individuals harmed in accidents caused by another party. In the event of an incident, it helps cover the costs associated with treatment, vehicle repairs, and other damages.MTPL is a mandatory requirement for all drivers.Before operating a vehicle, ensure your policy is active. Failure to comply with this requirement may result in substantial fines.When selecting an insurance company, it is essential to evaluate more than just the price of the policy. Key considerations include the company's reputation, the quality of its service, and the speed of its payouts.Choosing the right insurance company can prevent additional challenges in the event of an accident and ensure that you and the injured receive the necessary support and compensation.

items.question: What is MTPL (RCA)?
items.answer: MTPL (RCA) is mandatory motor third-party liability insurance that covers expenses in case of accidents caused by you.

items.question: How does MTPL (RCA) work?
items.answer: MTPL (RCA) protects drivers from financial losses in accidents that you cause. In the event of an accident, the insurance company compensates the damages incurred by the affected party.

items.question: How to obtain MTPL (RCA)?
items.answer: MTPL (RCA) can be arranged online through the insurance company's website or at an office by providing the required documents.

items.question: How can I verify the authenticity of the policy?
items.answer: The authenticity of the policy can be verified on the BNM website (https://rca.bnm.md/).

items.question: Is the insurance policy valid in electronic form?
items.answer: Yes, in Moldova, MTPL (RCA) insurance policies in electronic format are valid and recognized. According to current legislation, the policy can be issued and sent to the policyholder electronically.

items.question: What should I do if my car model is not found during the quote calculation?
items.answer: Calculation and issuance of the policy based on the registration certificate or license plate number are only possible for vehicles registered in the Republic of Moldova. If your vehicle cannot be identified or the price is not determined, please contact our support at info@asig.md or call +373 61 000 179.

items.question: If the insured party is a legal entity, how do I receive the tax invoice?
items.answer: The tax invoice will be sent via efactura.sfs.md. If your company is not registered for electronic tax invoicing, it will be sent via email with an electronic signature.

items.question: What does MTPL (RCA) cover?
items.answer: MTPL (RCA) (mandatory motor third-party liability insurance) is valid within the Republic of Moldova. It covers damages resulting from road accidents within the country. The insured risks include damages to third parties, such as bodily injury or death, and damage or destruction of property.

items.question: What are the maximum limits of damage compensation?
items.answer: The maximum compensation limits are: Up to 100,000 euros for property damage or destruction. Up to 100,000 euros per injured person in cases of bodily injury or death, but not exceeding 500,000 euros regardless of the number of victims. Up to 15,000 MDL for damages claimed through an amicable accident settlement process. Up to 5,000 euros for moral damages (only in cases of disability or death) per victim, but not exceeding 10,000 euros regardless of the number of victims.

items.question: What should be done in case of a claim?
items.answer: In the case of minor damage (estimated up to 15,000 MDL), you can opt for an amicable settlement without involving the police, known as 'constare amiabila'. This option is available if two vehicles with valid documents (MTPL (RCA) insurance, technical inspection) are involved in the accident. If an amicable settlement is not possible, a police report must be filed and provided to the insurance company.

items.question: What is not covered by the insurance?
items.answer: The insurance does not cover: Damage to the property of the insured, losses exceeding the maximum statutory compensation, damages caused at the workplace involving equipment, accidents occurring during loading and unloading of goods, etc.
